benchmark_details.name: OPENXRD
benchmark_details.overview: OPENXRD is an open-book pipeline designed for crystallography question answering, integrating textual prompts with concise supporting content generated by GPT-4. This framework uses a dataset consisting of 217 expert-level XRD questions to evaluate different vision-language models. The results show significant accuracy improvements for models utilizing GPT-4.5-generated summaries, especially those with limited prior training in crystallography.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a benchmarking framework for testing the capability of language models to comprehend and apply specialized crystallographic concepts.

data.source: Curated database of 217 expert-reviewed X-ray diffraction questions, some content partially drawn from established literature.
data.annotation: Each question was reviewed and approved by domain experts.

methods: Model evaluation under closed-book and open-book conditions
methodology.calculation: Accuracy = (Number of Correct Answers / Total Questions) * 100
methodology.interpretation: Accuracy is interpreted as the percentage of correctly answered questions from the total questions.
methodology.validation: The dataset and performance were validated against expert reviews.
